variable.name: EVENT
variable.comment: MI (events 1-5): Recognized means at time of MI occurrence, an MI was known to have taken place. Unrecognized means MI was not known to have taken place until later. MI (events 1-5): Silent MI means at time of MI there were no symptoms similar to MI symptoms. Not silent means that symptoms were present. MI (event 9): Coded when there has been a previously coded MI (1 or 2) and that MI shows on autopsy. AP (event 6) or IC (event 30): If date unavailable, midpoint between medical encounters (FHS exam, hospitalizations or MD office visits) was used. If AP occurred with MI or CI, then use same date as MI or CI. AP (event 6): Before 1987, if AP occurred just before MI or CI, then AP date was coded 3 months before MI/CI. If AP was just after MI/CI,then date was 3 months after MI/CI. Starting in 1987 if exact or approx. date of new AP was known that date was used. MI (event 8): Coded as exam 1 date unless other date is available. This event includes definite MI history without enzymes or autopsy, or possible MI on ECG. Does not include questionable AP.
variable.value: MI recognized, without diagnostic ECG, with enzymes and history
MI recognized,without diagnostic ECG, with autopsy evidence,new event(see code 9)
CI, definite by both history and ECG
MI acute autopsy, not a new event
Definite CVA at exam 1, but questionable type
TIA, only the first TIA is coded
Questionable CVA at exam 1, date of exam 1 (unless date available)
Death, CHD 48 hours or more, nonsudden
Questionable IC at exam 1 (date of exam 1 is used unless otherwise available)
CHF not hospitalized on exam or MD notes, if found on FHS exam, use FHS exam date
Questionable CHF at exam 1 (exam 1 date used unless other date is available)

variable.name: date
variable.comment: When exact date is unavailable, an approximate date or a midpoint date between two exams, two medical encounters or exam and medical may be used. Number of days since Exam 1.
